title: Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite, on cream laid paper
markings: Cooper Union stamp: # 457 D, lower left
inscribed: Below, pen and brown ink: No. 138 L'amour coupant les ailes a L'inconstance, eeg.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Base decorated with horizontally placed bow, erased arrows and a wreath of roses. Above, at right, a dial with a rose and bee at top. Below, an inscription, "Linconsatnt vaincu." At left, Cupid standing on a hassock cuts the wings of a bee.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-166.
